sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The right of kings by Scripture, or, A collection of some Scriptures shewing kings to be of God also, An essay for orderly hearing : together with A defence of Psalm-singing : in several dialogues with their supposed speakers / by Joseph Bentham, once again rector of the Church of Broughton in Northhamptonshire. Bentham, Joseph, 1594?-1671.
[12], 89 p.
Printed by E. C. for William Tompson, bookseller at Harborough in Leicestershire, London : 1661.
"The right of kings by Scripture, or, A collection of some Scriptures shewing kings to be of God", "An essay for orderly hearing, dialogue-wise", and "A defence of Psalm-singing, dialogue-wise" each have special t.p. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
The right of kings by Scripture, or, A collection of some Scriptures shewing kings to be of God also, An essay for orderly hearing : together with A defence of Psalm-singing : in several dialogues with their supposed speakers / by Joseph Bentham, once again rector of the Church of Broughton in Northhamptonshire. Bentham, Joseph, 1594?-1671.
[12], 89 p.
Printed by E. C. for William Tompson, bookseller at Harborough in Leicestershire, London : 1661.
"The right of kings by Scripture, or, A collection of some Scriptures shewing kings to be of God", "An essay for orderly hearing, dialogue-wise", and "A defence of Psalm-singing, dialogue-wise" each have special t.p. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
William Tompson
E. C.
Harborough in Leicestershire
